intro: Thermopsis subglabra, commonly known as yellow larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually glabrous or nearly hairless, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open meadows and along streambanks. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
